#summary Instructions on how to compile the Linux server.
#labels Featured


= Debian Instructions =
_Including derivatives such as Ubuntu_

=== Install dependencies ===
(skip sudo if you are root)
<br>Your setup may require more items.
<code>
sudo apt-get install subversion
sudo apt-get install dpkg-dev
sudo apt-get install libcurl4-gnutls-dev
sudo apt-get install libsqlite3-dev
sudo apt-get install libpcre3-dev
sudo apt-get install liblua5.1-0-dev</code>


=== Get the MTA source ===
<code>
svn checkout http://multitheftauto.googlecode.com/svn/trunk mtasvn/trunk
cd mtasvn/trunk</code>

=== Install sparsehash ===
<code>
cd vendor/sparsehash/current
autoreconf -fi
./configure
make install
cd ../../..</code>

=== Make Lua ===
<code>
cd vendor/lua/src
make linux
mkdir -p ../../../libs/lua
cp `*` ../../../libs/lua
cd ../../..</code>

=== Make MTA ===
<code>
autoreconf -fi
rm MTA10_Server/mods/deathmatch/Makefile.files
./configure
make</code>

=== Fill MTA output directory ===
<code>
strip -g MTA10_Server/launcher/mta-server -o MTA10_Server/output/mta-server
strip -g MTA10_Server/core/.libs/libcore.so -o MTA10_Server/output/core.so
strip -g Shared/XML/.libs/libxml.so -o MTA10_Server/output/xmll.so
strip -g MTA10_Server/mods/deathmatch/.libs/libdeathmatch.so -o MTA10_Server/output/mods/deathmatch/deathmatch.so</code>

=== Run MTA ===
<code>
cd MTA10_Server/ouput
./mta-server</code>

=== P.S. ===
You'll also need to add:
 * net.so into output
 * the .conf and .xml files into output/mods/deathmatch
 * the resources into output/mods/deathmatch/resources
<br><br>

----
=  Gentoo Instructions =

Use Debian instructions, except install dependencies with 'emerge' instead of 'apt-get install'. The name of the dependencies required may also be different.
